abstract.p: Robert A Fruge letter suggests that one reason Americans appear to be indifferent to global warming is that news media feel compelled to provide 'balance' by presenting 'pseudo-science' interpretations that there is no crisis of global warming (Bill McKibben's Sept 4 Op-Ed)

block.p: Bill McKibben (Op-Ed, Sept. 4) laments that Americans are indifferent to global warming. Yet the rest of the world seems to labor under no such skepticism. The reason, I would suggest, is the fault of the news media, which despite conclusive proof feel compelled to bring in some pseudo-scientist or another to offer a counter-opinion in order to give a story ''balance.'' If discredited ideas are thus always included, it should surprise no one that doubt about global warming still exists in the public mind.
ROBERT A. FRUGE Toluca Lake, Calif., Sept. 4, 1999
